column4: anyone here may help me solving a few problems I ran in with my "new" audigy 4 pro?
Just state your problem.  Depending on what it is, someone may answer or direct you to another channel for support.
my "new" audigy 4 pro produces crackling noise with my external 5.1 speakers connected to the main sound card - the headphones connected to the external I/O hub are working flawlessly ...
Is your I/O hub connected to the audigy, or another on-board sound card?
the I/O hub is connected to the audigy card
Is this PCI or PCI express?
Does the crackling occur with all output, or just certain (AAC, for example) output?
Also, does crackling occur when no sound is playing?
this is the card we are talking about http://tinyurl.com/8hx88
the noise does only occure when some kind of sound is played
Have you tried adjusting the mixer?  (alsa-mixer)
i already changed the pci slot, i reinstalled all alsa related stuff, i deleted my .asoundrc und generated it new with asoundconf ...
yes, of course
Is there an onboard sound card too?  If so, try disabling its kernel driver.
no, onboard sound is disabled
Is this an Ubuntu-specific or Linux-specific problem?
Which kernel driver handles the audigy 4?  (lsmod | grep snd)

that's the point I want to find out. the problem is, that only few people own such a highend audigy card and therefor the number of people to ask is very limited. I'm also in discussion with some guys from the alsa project do determine if it's probably an alsa bug
It's almost certarinly a problem in alsa.  Have you tried the latest svn code for alsa?  (You should be able to compile it for the 2.6.22 kernel)
I'm still using feisty. I didn't have the time to run a dist-upgrade yet
You should check in the latest kernel.  (Use a livecd)
Alsa bugs are fixed all the time, especially for new cards.
thanks for the hint
